intro: Calycadenia bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy yellow and purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, while its stems are usually hairy and upright. Calycadenia bicolor is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and chaparral.
